# Agent Skills

Production-grade skill library for Claude Code CLI. 60+ skills organized by domain, tool-specific configs, and orchestration patterns for complex workflows.

## What This Is

A curated collection of reusable AI agent skills that enhance Claude Code's capabilities:

- **Skills**: Specialized knowledge bundles (Flutter architecture, API testing, code review, etc.)
- **Tool Configs**: Claude Code, Cursor, Gemini CLI, and Codex-specific setups
- **Orchestration**: Multi-agent coordination patterns for complex workflows
- **Templates**: Project scaffolding and standard file structures

## Quick Install

### Claude Code
```bash
# Clone and setup
git clone https://github.com/thesimpleapp/agent-skills.git
cd agent-skills
./scripts/setup.sh  # Mac/Linux
# or
.scriptssetup.ps1  # Windows

# Skills available immediately via slash commands
/orchestrator
/flutter-excellence
/parallel-swarm
```

### Cursor
```bash
./scripts/install-cursor.sh
# Installs 8 agents, 3 rules, templates to .cursor/
```

### Gemini CLI & Other Tools
See [tools/](tools/) for tool-specific setup guides.

## How Skills Work

Skills are YAML frontmatter + markdown instructions that Claude Code loads on-demand:

```yaml
---
name: my-skill
description: When to use this skill and what it does
---

# Skill Content

Instructions, patterns, rules, and examples that guide the AI.
```

**Invocation**: `/my-skill` or automatic when description matches task

**Skill composition**: Skills can reference other skills via the skill router pattern

## Orchestration 101

### Built Into Claude Code

- **Task tool**: Spawn subagents (Explore, Plan, Bash, etc.) - up to 7 parallel
- **Subagents**: Specialized agents with scoped tools and context
- Docs: [code.claude.com/docs/en/sub-agents](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/sub-agents)

### This Repo Adds

- **orchestrator** skill: Intelligent task analysis and agent routing
- **parallel-swarm** skill: Patterns for 10+ parallel agents (Feature Blast, Test Blitz, Analysis, Bulk Refactor)
- **context-loader** skill: Selective context loading for large codebases

### When to Use What

| Scenario | Tool |
|----------|------|
| Simple research or file exploration | Built-in Task tool with Explore agent |
| Complex multi-domain task | `/orchestrator` skill |
| 5+ parallel independent tasks | `/parallel-swarm` skill |
| Large codebase (10k+ files) | `/context-loader` first |

See [ORCHESTRATION.md](ORCHESTRATION.md) for comprehensive patterns and examples.

## Flutter Skills Architecture

Flutter has a unique 3-tier structure:

**Tier 1 (Always Active)**: `flutter-clean-arch` - 188-line guardrail enforcing Riverpod + Clean Architecture

**Tier 2 (Pull by Task)**: Premium UI, API integration, testing, etc. (~300-1100 lines each)

**Tier 3 (Specialized)**: Deployment, platform channels, legacy patterns

See [skills/flutter/README.md](skills/flutter/README.md) for full details.

## Integration with Other Tools

### Oh My Claude Code (OMC)
Third-party plugin with 32 agents + 5 execution modes. Complements this repo.
- This repo: Domain knowledge (Flutter, React, Supabase patterns)
- OMC: Execution orchestration (Autopilot, Ultrapilot, Swarm modes)
- Use together: OMC for orchestration, agent-skills for domain expertise

### Cursor
Uses same skill files, different activation (.cursor/agents/ + rules/)

### Gemini CLI Conductor
Context-driven development with product.md + tech-stack.md + workflow.md
Templates in [tools/gemini-cli/conductor/](tools/gemini-cli/conductor/)

## Keeping This Repo Updated

### When New Tools Emerge

1. Check if the tool uses SKILL.md standard → works out of the box
2. If custom format → add adapter in `tools/<tool-name>/`
3. Update this README with integration notes

### When New Patterns Emerge

1. Extract pattern into skill in `skills/<category>/<pattern-name>/`
2. Add to category table above
3. Test with `/skill-name` invocation

### When Skills Conflict or Overlap

1. Check [skills/flutter/README.md](skills/flutter/README.md) for tier-based organization example
2. Prefer: One always-active guardrail + on-demand reference materials
3. Avoid: Multiple skills defining same architecture in different ways

## Contributing

Skills should be:
- **Concise**: 100-300 lines for guardrails, 300-1000 for reference
- **Focused**: Single responsibility
- **Actionable**: Include examples and anti-patterns
- **Tested**: Verify slash command invocation works
